definition[0]: to persuade someone to accept or buy something that is not of good quality or is not the thing that they really want
example[0]: He tried to palm off his old books onto me.
example[1]: Dealers sometimes palm off fakes as genuine works of art.
definition[1]: to persuade someone to accept something, especially by making them think it is better or more valuable than it really is
example[2]: Some suppliers have tried to palm off cheap telephones or outdated fax machines.
example[3]: a worthless ring which he palmed off on an unwary buyer
